[8356287]

Steve was still gripping the yoke of the patrol ship, which had never left the bay. All his ego and thrill-seeking bravado had choked. He watched a ship made of human flesh land right beside him, and didn't do a single thing about it. He watched the Deadlaus escape the swarms of infected and leave the orbit of Forendor. And still he sat there, sweating and mumbling to himself.

Finally he crawled back out of the fighter and trudged to the shower.
On july 20, 2014
[5367939]

Charles did not expect to become captain, his first day certainly had been hectic to say the least.

Relations with the Forendor had gone south, or so he felt.

Dawn, Samuel, and possibly this Terry knew something about this planet and what had happened here in the past to create the infected. He was itching to ask them all sorts of questions, but he wasn't sure whether to do it privately or right now on the bridge...

Meantime, he also should really learn about this crew. They apparently had the qualifications to save the earth from the alien threats and whatever this mush was.

Finally, he broke his reverie of thought.

"Comms, is everyone on board? All patrol ships landed?"

"Astro, is there a class 2 nebula nearby on sensors, or on star charts?"

On july 20, 2014
[8356287]

Steve finished his shower and began wandering the ship. He passed by several other crew members, but never raised his gaze from the floor.

After a while, he found himself at the entrance to the brig. He saw Stark pacing around in one of the cells. That cheered him up a little bit. Steve quietly walked away before Stark saw him.

Eventually he got tired of wandering and decided to lie down. He went to the dorm and noticed a cat lying on a bed with no sheets. That's strange, he thought - a cat on a star ship? He sat down beside the cat. She was startled and looked up at him, but he didn't touch her. He just sat there beside her. Then she put her head back down and snuggled into a more comfortable position. After a moment, Steve reached out and stroked her soft fur. She purred, and Steve felt like everything was going to be okay. Somehow.

Jessica and Colin had stayed on the Bridge after the new Captain was elected. They talked amongst themselves and tried not to get in the way. Colin filled her in on the the sample of the monster that had tried to attack her at the base: it was a human-alien hybrid infected with a mind-controlling parasitic fungus that spread rampantly throughout all living tissues. Jessica was alarmed, but not surprised. Her doctoral thesis on xenomorphic recombinant DNA synthesis had predicted that such a thing would be possible. She just never imagined that it would actually be discovered in her own lifetime.

After some excited discussion, they spoke up and shared their theories with the Captain and others on the Bridge.

RESEARCH

Jessica had been in the Medlab, assisting Colin with the analysis of samples taken. It was a team effort, and she provided several key insights.

Finally, with fresh, pure, samples of the parasitic organism, they began their research in earnest.

5 samples had been taken. (minimum 3)
25% of them had active infection. (minimum 1)

Jessica began trying to find a way to detect infection without killing the host.

OOC: Detection research will "upgrade" through the following pathway:

1. Brain biopsy and cell culture analysis - takes 1 full day
2. Eye biopsy with advanced analysis - takes 1 hour
3. Skin biopsy with custom scanner device - immediate results
4. Retinal scanner
5. Proximity detector (within same room)
6. Remote ship scanner (within narrow beam, 10 kilometer range)
7. Planetary scanner (entire planet from orbit)

The current status of detection research research will be represented by a single number. At reasonable intervals I'll roll d100 to increase the number. When it reaches 100 or more, an upgrade is complete, and the number resets to zero.

Jessica's first session with detection research: 69

MEANWHILE, Colin was working to find a cure. He prepped 78+15 compounds with known anti-fungal properties as candidate cures. New compounds may be discovered on explored planets, d20+d20 per planet.

Colin will test these compounds in batches of 10. Each one has a 1% chance to be effective. When a compound is effective, I'll roll a d20 to determine the percentage of HOW effective it is.

These compounds can be combined in a drug cocktail, with the following results, depending on total percentage effectiveness of all compounds:

0% - 19% No effect
20% - 39% Slows progression slightly
40% - 59% Slows progression greatly
60% - 69% Suppression, infection cannot progress further than it already has
70% - 79% Suppression, host can communicate, but Mush still in control
80% - 89% Suppression, host in control, but Mush can still communicate
90% - 99% Partial cure, but mutation not reversed
100% Complete cure, reversal of mutation

Instead of the 3 spores mechanic from the game, I'd like to represent the progression of the infection through a series of stages. What I mean is, a single exposure is enough, but it takes some time to work its way through the system and take control. I'll leave it to EoN to decide how that works.

Colin's first session with cure research:
8624689319465186398
(A roll of 1 is an effective compound.)

[8356287]
